summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence primarily between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and a federal prosecutor (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York, discussing the scheduling of meetings and a proffer session for a client in the Epstein investigation. The emails span from July 2019 to September 2021 and reveal logistical planning for in-person meetings in Florida.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a client in the Epstein investigation, coordinating meeting times and proffer sessions with federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented a person (name redacted) who was served with a grand jury subpoena in the Epstein case.

connections.description: Former law partners; Nascimento took over as inventory attorney for Ross's client after Ross's death.

events.title: Initial Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Joseph Nascimento meets with federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach to discuss his client's case.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session is scheduled for Nascimento's client with federal prosecutors in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Rescheduled Virtual Hearing
events.description: Nascimento informs prosecutors that a virtual hearing is running long, causing a delay for their scheduled meeting.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: Federal agents serve a grand jury subpoena related to the Epstein investigation to an individual previously represented by Alan Ross.

locations: Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd
2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, Miami, FL 33129 (Nascimento's law office)
keyFacts: Attorney Joseph Nascimento is actively coordinating proffer sessions and meetings for a client with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York from 2019 to 2021.
The emails reference a grand jury subpoena being served in July 2019 to an individual previously represented by Nascimento's deceased former partner, Alan Ross.
Meetings between the defense and prosecution were planned to occur in person at a hotel in West Palm Beach, Florida.
The correspondence shows the ongoing nature of the investigation and cooperation discussions years after Epstein's arrest and death.
Multiple names and email addresses of prosecutors and possibly a client are redacted throughout the document chain.
